open up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if opportunities open up, or a new situation opens them up, they become available or possible
open up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: With a microscope, a whole new world of investigation opens up.
The new international agreement opens up the possibility of much greater co-operation against terrorism.
open up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if someone opens up an area of land, they make it easier to reach and ready for development
open up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The new road will open up 300 acres of prime development land.
open up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to open something that is closed, locked, or covered
open up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Open up, this is the police!
He opened up his case and took out a clean sweater.
open up.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if a shop, office etc opens up or is opened up, someone starts it
open up.translation[0].definitions[4].de: if a shop, office etc opens up at a particular time, it starts business at that time
open up.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to start a discussion or argument
open up.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: The article was written with the intention of opening up a public debate.
open up.translation[0].definitions[6].de: if someone opens up a lead in a competition or race, they increase the distance or number of points by which they are winning
open up.translation[0].definitions[7].de: to stop being shy and say what you really think
open up.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: Last night was the first time that Ken had opened up about his feelings.
open up.translation[0].definitions[9].de: if a hole, crack etc opens up or is opened up, it appears and becomes wider
open up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: if a new business opens up or is opened up, someone starts it
open up.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: More than a dozen US law firms have opened up in the city.
open up.translation[1].definitions[1].de: if a shop, business etc opens up or is opened up at a particular time, it starts business at that time
open up.translation[1].definitions[2].de: if a country or market opens up, or someone opens it up, it becomes possible or easier to invest there or sell foreign goods there
open up.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Algeria opened up its big oil and natural gas industry to foreign investment.
When China opened up, over-optimistic Americans were full of ideas of selling to one billion Chinese.
open up.translation[1].definitions[3].de: if a job opens up, it becomes available
open up.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: When the U.S. attorney’s job opened up, he applied.
